comments:
Whenever I run a plugin that has been created using the HelloWorld template
using the run-time Workbench, I get the following error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.isAlreadyRunning(Main.java:1443)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:577)

No source is attached to org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main in the standard.

Configuration:
Mac OS X 10.2.8
Eclipse 3.0M7

Gerd

sounds like you are using an old vm.  You need 1.4.1 vm or higher for 3.0.
Is this the case here?

This is what I suspect, too, but...

gerd% java -version
java version "1.4.1_01"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1_01-69.1)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.1_01-24, mixed mode)
Andre, what are the exact requirements for Mac?

Just for documentation:

1.4.1_01 is, to my knowledge, the newest Java available for Jaguar 10.2.8.
I don't think there will ever be a newer Java for Jaguar.

There is a newer Java version 1.4.2 which requires Panther 10.3.x

1.4.1 for Jaguar is fine.
However, in the near future (before we ship 3.0) we'll require Panther.

But I'll try to reproduce the problem...

Hmm, we had this error running with 1.3 VMs (see bug 47233). Any chance of
another VM being accidently picked up? Although we require 1.4, we don't prevent
running with a 1.3 VM (it just fails in some VM dependant way). Bug 44814
addresses that.

Hmmm, I was unable to reproduce the problem.
Here is what I did:
- Installed Jaguar (10.2.7) on an external disk.
- via Software Update upgraded to 10.2.8 and installed all OS patches and Java updates
- downloaded Eclipse 3.0 M7 to my Desktop (Stuffit Expander unpacked it automatically)
- double clicked Eclipse.app (to launch it with fresh workspace)
- opened New wizard and in category "Plug-in Development" created new Plug-in Project
- on next page named it "Hello"
- pressed "Next" three times
- on Template page checked "Create a plug-in..."
- selected "Hello World"
- pressed "Finish"
- Answered "no" to question whether to switch to PDE perspective
- manually switched to Java perspective
- selected Hello project
- from toolbar drop down item "Run Run-time workbench" selected Run As ... > Run-time Workbench

New Eclipse launched. From "Sample Menu" selected "Sample Action".
Everything seems to work fine (at least for me).

So here's the question: does it work for you if you follow exactly my steps from above?

Andre,

I have no 10.2.7 to install (started Jaguar with 10.2.0) so I reproduced your
test with 
- downloaded Eclipse 3.0 M7 to my Desktop (Stuffit Expander unpacked it
automatically)

-> it works. 
Thanks and sorry. 

Seems I have a corrupted workspace. Everything else works.
Wish myself fun to fix this :-)

Gerd
